channel.title: Garbage laptop, cannot disable the touchpad
channel.description:
So. My friend gave me a laptop for helping her with another one of hers (you'll see why they didn't give a shit about it in the first place). I basically took it for scrap, figured I could take the HDD and shit like that if I needed em. When I got it, it was disgusting. The keyboard made me want to vomit, it was covered in... everything... That got replaced. There are burn marks (from cigarettes, so I'm told) on the touchpad and various parts of the laptop. And the battery doesn't stay in it's taped with electrical tape atm).
Well, my mother has a netbook (yeah those garbage things). And it's crapping out on her. The screen doesn't stay on unless you have it in certain positions (bad wire). And it's just hella slow, because that's how netbooks are.
I figured, hey, I can fix the laptop up a bit so it's usable and whatnot, so my mom has a better computer to use. Well I've ran into an issue with that. [u]The touchpad[/u]. It freaks the fudge out, a lot. And spazzes across the screen (ONLY vertically). I cannot control it when it does this, I try but the spazzing gives me no budge. It also cannot move anywhere horizontally across the screen when it does this. My solution was to just buy a crappy wired mouse and just use that for input. Here comes complication #2. The touchpad won't disable. I tried disabling it in the control panel, by going to mouse and then finding the device (there were 2 input devices, even without the wired mouse plugged in). Only one can disable, and it doesn't disable the touch pad. I tried disabling it in the device manager, but same issue. I also tried finding new update drivers for it, to see if that'd give me some form of control. Nope. [b]There is no icon in the taskbar for it.[/b] Also, the FN key to disable it doesn't do shit. All the others do, but that one (WTF right?)
So... How can I disable the touchpad? If I have to, and all comes down to it, I'll just unplug the damn thing from the mobo.
It's a Compaq Presario CQ60 running Windows 7 Ultimate (x64).

item.title: Garbage laptop, cannot disable the touchpad
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

wildskiller:

Check the Device Manager for any devices that can be disabled that might not be specific of what device is. Just try disabling devices one at a time and see if the touch pad stops working. A lot of the current HP, ASUS, and DELL laptops will have one of the ‘F’ keys to switch the touch pad or cursor on/off.

Thank you for restating the entire thread into one post.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

Check the Device Manager for any devices that can be disabled that might not be specific of what device is. Just try disabling devices one at a time and see if the touch pad stops working. A lot of the current HP, ASUS, and DELL laptops will have one of the ‘F’ keys to switch the touch pad or cursor on/off.

item.title: Garbage laptop, cannot disable the touchpad
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Vain_:

You have to take it apart and check the ribbons… Try unplugging the screen and replugging it in. Also try giving some bend to the screen to see if they move at all or not.

Haven’t taken it apart at all. Waiting for my ram cards to arrive…
Here’s a pic of the laptop, in all of it’s not glory…
Notice the touchpad… yea…
[spoiler=LargeAssImage]

[/spoiler]

Edit:
Well, got the parts in. That’s good.
Bad news: Wrong parts… The RAM was incorrect. Went for 2x 2GB, and got 2x 1GB. So literally no upgrade there lol. The mouse I got is fine though.
So I gotta send the RAM back and order new… Yay. Delay shit…

Read full topic

item.title: Garbage laptop, cannot disable the touchpad
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Could be a gpu problem, bad ribbon, or bad lcd. It’s far easier to just deal with it than to start replacing those as they get high.

item.title: Garbage laptop, cannot disable the touchpad
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Ashi:

I tho unplugging it would be the least technical way. OT is drugged.

I think you need to re-read your reply… No one said that unplugging it was not the ‘least technical way’.
I just wanted to avoid digging into the laptop.

Anyways, an update:
Took the RAM out of the computer, only to find it had 2x 1GB sticks, unlike what it said on the website… It said it had 1 2GB ram, leaving one slot open. I had to buy 2x 2GB sticks. They were still cheap.
I also bought a crappy mouse for it (whatever works). They should be here by tomorrow (thursday).
Only cost me like $20 bucks or so. I was considering buying a replacement touch pad, but honestly, the external mouse is like 1000% cheaper than the replacement. So.

Oh hey, kinda off topic… But is there a way to remove the pink line of dead pixels that goes directly in the middle of the screen, without buying a new screen. I doubt it personally, but worth a shot in asking…

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Ashi:

Manually unplug it - cheap, works, no fuss.

As you act when I reply to your threads, I do not want you in mine. So please, don’t come back to respond.

[quote=“Muroth, post:19, topic:546957”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=665855.msg4451868#msg4451868 date=1412117229]

4GB is plenty for everything other than hardcore gaming, assuming you have a decent gpu. Just make sure to get 64bit instead of 32 bit.

Since when were there 32 bit and 64 bit RAM?
[/quote]

OS I mean, since 4gb is the max for 32bit Windows. It will be a bit better performance switching to a 64-bit OS as it’ll limit the 4GB to ~3.92 or so[/quote]
Already running a 64 bit OS :3

Read full topic

item.source: Garbage laptop, cannot disable the touchpad

item.title: Garbage laptop, cannot disable the touchpad
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

CoonHunter:

As stated several times the best option is to unplug the touchpad. If the driver fails to uninstall and there’s no button (sometimes there’s a function setup for this) to disable it then unplugging is your only option. It’s very simple as long as you take your time and try your best not to static shock the mobo.

Yeah I figured as much.

I plan on buying some more ram for the computer too, maybe an upgrade on the hard drive.
Ain’t much else I think needs to be updated.

Also, turns out there is a button to disable the pad. But, as I said, the pile of crap doesn’t work…
http://www.hp.com/ctg/Manual/c02985882.pdf (page 18)
There’s no indicator light visible, so it’s probably broke as well…

Also, sadly, apparently this laptop can only support 4 gigs of ram…

Read full topic
item.source: Garbage laptop, cannot disable the touchpad

item.title: Garbage laptop, cannot disable the touchpad
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

As stated several times the best option is to unplug the touchpad. If the driver fails to uninstall and there’s no button (sometimes there’s a function setup for this) to disable it then unplugging is your only option. It’s very simple as long as you take your time and try your best not to static shock the mobo.

item.source: Garbage laptop, cannot disable the touchpad

item.title: Garbage laptop, cannot disable the touchpad
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

[quote=“PaulT, post:13, topic:546957”]I was repairing a laptop for work and I broke one of the tiny little ribbon cable holders. I was pretty much screwed. Client was on his way back, laptop had to be fixed. It was almost impossible to thread the little rascal back into place and then tape it. The little plastic holders can be extremely delicate depending on how thick they are.

Anytime you have the opportunity to take something apart, I would take it. It’s the best. I have a few kindle HDx Tablets laying around that I have to dissemble one of these days; perfect condition, just the screen is smashed to bits. I can’t wait to take them apart.[/quote]

I’ve learned so much from taking apart random electronics. Taking an electronics class now to learn more. Some things were perfectly working, others were 10+ years old and we upgraded or didn’t work and I got them to work.

Read full topic
item.source: Garbage laptop, cannot disable the touchpad

item.title: Garbage laptop, cannot disable the touchpad
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

I was repairing a laptop for work and I broke one of the tiny little ribbon cable holders. I was pretty much screwed. Client was on his way back, laptop had to be fixed. It was almost impossible to thread the little rascal back into place and then tape it. The little plastic holders can be extremely delicate depending on how thick they are.

Anytime you have the opportunity to take something apart, I would take it. It’s the best. I have a few kindle HDx Tablets laying around that I have to dissemble one of these days; perfect condition, just the screen is smashed to bits. I can’t wait to take them apart.
